It was a peaceful day as Mark made his way home from school. As he did, he decided to cut through the forest for a shortcut.

It was then that he noticed a box that seemed to be lying in the middle of the forest. His curiosity piqued, he decided to check it out, and walked over to it. Opening it, he saw that inside the box was three hi-tech looking armbands. Next to them was a piece of paper, and he picked it up and read it.

"The Super Swaper. It can swap things between the user and another! Just select your choices and aim it at your target and activate it, and then you'll swap whatever you selected with the target!" it said.

"What the? Is this thing for real?" Mark questioned. It sounded completely ridiculous. But then again, it sounded so interesting that he just had to try it out. He then put on one of the so-called Super Swapper and put the other two in his pockets. He then thought about where to try it out.

Mark decided that he should try something simple at first. Looking at the options he decided he should try out headwear at first. That decided he pressed the button and was instantly disorientated because a bright flash appeared.

When he could see again he still saw his sister reading her book. But something was different about her. Now that he mentioned it... Something was different about his view as well. It was like he was watching through glass or something and everything what was around that was kinda blurry.

Suddenly he knew what was so different about Rachel. She was not wearing her glasses! Instead he was wearing them right now.

Suprised, Mark took the glasses off of his nose and saw that the world has gotten blurry. When he put them back on, the world focused again.

"How is this possible? She has bad eyes, she needs glasses!", he thought. "But... Wait a minute... I swapped headwear... So this might include glasses... No this certainly includes glasses, there is no other explanation why I'm wearing her glasses right now.".

Mark walked back slightly, because Rachel looked up. He did not want to get noticed. She was drying of a tear. It seems as if she was just reading a sad part. She did not seem to notice that she was not wearing any glasses. In fact, she was touching her face like she had no glasses.

"It seems reality has changed... Or she's so engrossed in the book.", he thought. "Let's consider reality had changed.", he continued in mind. "If I have her headwear, including glasses, this would mean I need glasses... And although I have not swapped eyes, I now have her bad eye sight.".

Mark looked down at the device. "Amazing. It really seems as if it changed. But I should check out if reality really changed.", he thought and went up to Rachel.

"Hey, Rach.", he greeted her smilingly. She looked up from her book and at Mark. "Hey Mark. How're you doing.".

"She really doesn't notice.", he thought. "Fine.", he grinned at her. "I see that you're reading, I guess I'll let you alone. See ya.". He turned around and went back inside quickly.

"The thing really works!", he thought. "What now?".

11331212121.content:
A part of you feels bat about making Lilly feel so crummy about herself. You and her might not get along so well, but you don’t want her to suffer like that. She’d gone back to watching her soap opera and wasn’t paying attention to you as you pulled up the menu on the Super Swapper again. You thumbed through the different options it offered and saw one that caught your attention. The tab read “Feminine Personality Traits”. Surely if her personality wasn’t so girly she wouldn’t mind not being good at traditionally girly things like applying makeup.

With a simple click you set the Super Swapper to make the switch. Thankfully you knew what to expect this time so the exchange wasn’t as disorienting as the first time. However, when you looked over at Lilly the change was immediately apparent. Gone were her usually tight and feminine clothes. Instead she wore a simple t-shirt and jeans that you could have sworn were for a guy. She wasn’t watching a soap opera anymore either. She seemed engrossed in some spy show or something. ‘That soap actually looked interesting,’ you think to yourself finding that you preferred storied with emotion and depth, not just mindless explosions.

Lilly didn’t look depressed like before so you walked over to grab the nail polish, acetone and cotton balls she’d had before to take them to your room. “Yeah, you shouldn’t leave all your makeup stuff around the house, Mark,” she said, goading you to fight with her (like you used to do), but you decided not to engage with her (which was very out of character for you). You purposely ignored her and went to your room with your stuff. It was a bit surprising to see how neat and orderly it was. It was nicely decorated, especially for a room belonging to a teenage boy. The old you wouldn’t have cared to use a scent diffuser, but you instantly noted the hints of honey suckle wafting through the room the moment you walked in. Looking in the mirror of what had been Lilly’s makeup table you saw a different version of yourself than you were used to.

You had light, yet noticeable makeup, with countering enhancing your bone structure. Your hair was still short, but it was styled for a more sophisticated look. Your clothes were tighter and more fashionable as well. You had to admit that this was a much better looking version of you. Freshening up your foundation you blew a kiss at yourself. There was something that felt off to you though. You definitely liked this version of you more than the old one, but you still saw a guy in the mirror even though at your core you felt like a woman.

That sense of being the wrong gender had kicked in the moment you made the last swap, and there was a piece of you that thought reversing the swaps would be the best idea, but a greater part of you enjoyed this new you. You were … dare you say it, pretty and you liked being pretty. Was that wrong? No, of course it wasn’t!

Now, with the Super Swapper you could swap whatever you wanted until you felt good with your reflection. The question was where to go.

info.brief_description: Follow Mark Stevens as he uses a strange device to swap with others
info.description:
Created in by Some Random Person in conjunction with their good friend Hidden in a Box. If you like anime based stories, be sure to check out his version as well.

Main Characters:
Mark Stevens - The story protagonist. 16 years old. Average guy, enjoys video games. Being the only boy in the only boy in the house, he doesn't always get along with his three sisters.

Angela Thomas - One of Mark's best friends, and neighbor. Can be a bit girly, but enjoys hanging out and playing video games with Mark. Mark secretly has a crush on her.
Jack Miller - Mark's other best friend, and other neighbor.

Stevens Family:
Kathy Stevens - 7 years old. Mark's youngest sister. Typical young girly-girl. loves princesses, dolls, ballet, the color pink, and other stereotypical girly things. Likes to annoy Mark.
Rachel Stevens - 13 years old. Mark's younger sister. Reltively shy, and the only one of his sisters that Mark gets along with as neither has any problem with the other. Wears glasses.
Lily Stevens - 18 years old. Mark's older sister. A relatively popular girl at the high school she and Mark go to, and is one of the cheerleaders. Hobbies include shopping for clothes, and is rather vain with how her clothes look. Gets along with Mark the least.
Nancy Stevens - Mark and his sister's single mother.


Thomas Family:
Paul Thomas - 10 years old. Angela's younger brother. Into sports and likes to annoy his sisters, and is a bit of a brat.
Cindy Thomas - 13 years old. Angela's younger sister, and Rachel's best friend.
Irene Thomas - Angela, Cindy, and Paul's mother.
John Thomas - Angela, Cindy, and Paul's father.

Miller Family:
Kelly Miller - 7 years old. Jack's little sister and best friends with Kathy. Just as girly as her.
Joe Miller - Jack and Kelly's father.
Pam Miller - Jack and Kelly's mother.

Feel free to add more characters.
Also feel free to move away from Mark and his family and friends and focus on a different character,

The Super Swapper
-It is a metalic band worn around the wrist. While worn, only those with another Super Swapper can see it. The device is not attatched, and can be taken off.
-Reality adjusts after each swap so that everything seems normal. Swaps are only noticed by those with a Super Swapper. If they take off the Super Swapper, they will still be aware of the the swaps that happened while they wore it, but will not notice any swaps that happen while they don't wear it.
-Swaps are between the user and the target.
-The device has a 5 buttons that correspond to the 5 categories, a screen on it that displays the options for each swap, and 2 arrow buttons to scroll the options on the screen, a button to approve each part of a swap, and the activation button.
-Swaps of any of the 4 categories can be all at once or only one or a few.
-When doing a swap, you select the options before hand, then aim at the target and press the activation button. Whoever it is aimed at when you press the activation button will be swapped with, whether it was the intended target or not.
-When using the Life and Personality options together, if you switch lives with someone, and then switch personalities with that person while still in their life, you will recieve their own original personality instead of the personality of their current life.
-Even though they will be completely aware that the swap happened, switches that affect them meantally such as Personality and certain Life options will have full effect. They will know that they have switched, but how they now act will seem perfectly normal to them.
-The Super Swapper only works on living things, and certain options do not work on animals.
-Very hard impacts, and electrical surges to the device will cause the device to temporarily malfunction, and the device will not always perform the intended swaps and it may choose random options instead. This malfunction does not change how the device works.
-The Super Swapper can not swap with someone else with a Super Swapper without their permission.


Clothes:
Torso - Shirts
Legs - Pants, skirts
Footwear - Shoes, socks
Headwear - Glasses, hats
Underwear - For women, bra also counts as part of this
Accessories - Makeup, jewlery
Tattoos

Clothing swaps do not work on animals

Body:
Head
Hair
Eyes
Facial Hair
Body Hair
Torso
Arms
Hands
Legs
Feet
Genitals
Voice
Skin

Body swaps do not work on animals

Life:
First Name
Skills - Single, Multiple, or All
Relationships - Friends and/or family - Single, Multiple, or All
Status - Popularity, The way people generally think of you
Occupation - Pertains to work and school - Single, Multiple, or All
Gender - Version 1 makes it so thar it does not actually change their gender, but makes other perceive them as that gender. Version 2 makes it
Age - Does not actually change your age, but makes others perceive you as that age
Possessions - Things you own, other than clothing - Single, Multiple, or All

Personality:
Interests - Single, Multiple, or All
Mannerisms - Posture, way you walk, way you talk

If you have ideas for extra options, please ask first, and if approved will be added to the list.


No killing off characters
No ending the story
No one option paths. Always leave at least two options
Try to have good grammar.
While its okay in early parts of the story, as it goes on, no one line additions. Try to write at least a paragraph
Keep thing consistent with what happened in the path, and read to make sure you don't contradict things before you post
